intro: Weinmannia negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a leathery texture, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
